lines.text: You treat a disease, you win, you lose. You treat a person, I guarantee you, you'll win, no matter what the outcome.

I love you without knowing how, or when, or from where. I love you straightforwardly without complexities or pride. I love you because I know no other way then this. So close that your hand, on my chest, is my hand. So close, that when you close your eyes, I fall asleep.
Our job is improving the quality of life, not just delaying death.
You're focusing on the problem. If you focus on the problem, you can't see the solution. Never focus on the problem!

[standing on the edge of a cliff contemplating suicide. He talks to God... ]
So what now, huh? What do you want from me?
[looks down over cliff, a rock tumbles off]

Yeah, I could do it. We both know you wouldn't stop me. So answer me please. Tell me what you're doing. Okay, let's look at the logic. You create man. Man suffers enormous amounts of pain. Man dies. Maybe you should have had just a few more brainstorming sessions prior to creation. You rested on the seventh day. Maybe you should've spent that day on compassion.
[looks down over the cliff again]
You know what? You're not worth it.
[walks away from the cliff]

What's wrong with death sir? What are we so mortally afraid of? Why can't we treat death with a certain amount of humanity and dignity, and decency, and God forbid, maybe even humor. Death is not the enemy gentlemen. If we're going to fight a disease, let's fight one of the most terrible diseases of all, indifference.
See what no one else sees. See what everyone chooses not to see... out of fear, conformity or laziness. See the whole world anew each day!
In the middle of the journey of my life, I found myself in a dark wood, for I had lost the right path. Eventually I would find the right path, but in the most unlikely place.
We can head on down to the maternity ward. You know those chicks put out.
We need to start treating the patient as well as the disease.
Last night with Rudy, I connected to another human being. I want more of that. I want to learn about people, help them with their troubles.
That's what I do.
But you suck at it.
[while Patch is driving]
When can I open my eyes?
As soon as I open mine.

Death. To die. To expire. To pass on. To perish. To peg out. To push up daisies. To push up posies. To become extinct. Curtains, deceased, Demised, departed And defunct. Dead as a doornail. Dead as a herring. Dead as a mutton. Dead as nits. The last breath. Paying a debt to nature. The big sleep. God's way of saying, "Slow down."
To check out.
To shuffle off this mortal coil.
To head for the happy hunting ground.
To blink for an exceptionally long period of time.
To find oneself without breath.
To be the incredible decaying man.
Worm buffet.
Kick the bucket.
Buy the farm.
Take the cab.
Cash in your chips.
I don't like you!
Why don't you like me? You're a prick and I like you.
Sir, I want to be a doctor will all my heart.
I am a thorn that will not go away
Is that all?
I hope not, sir.
I wanted to become a doctor so I could serve others. And because of that, I've lost everything. But I've also gained everything.

[while in group session]
Beanie... which way is Heaven?
[who is in a catatonic state, keeps his arm raise, pointing upwards]

When I was a girl I would look out my bedroom window at the caterpillars; I envied them so much. No matter what they were before, no matter what happened to them, they could just hide away and turn into these beautiful creatures that could fly away completely untouched.

[imitating a skeleton]
I have a boner. Wait, I am a boner.
And if we bury you ass up, I have got a place to park my bike.
Hi. Patch Adams.
Mitch Roman. Georgetown University. I was awarded the William F. Thompson Scientific Achievement Award.
Mmm. Emerson Elementary. I once drew a picture of a rabbit that got me two gold stars.

[Joletta has just met Patch]
Look here, Judy, another future boss.
Oh, I wouldn't look at it like that.
You may think I'm exaggerating, but in another five years you'll be so full of yourself you'll have to hang a cup out your ass just to catch the excess.
You don't understand, I'm leaving
Hunter, if you leave my records will say AMA, you left against medical advice.
And Mine will say IDGARA, I don't give a rat's ass. And my name is Patch.
I thought only I could repel women with that kind of raw efficiency.
I'm really starting to love the back of your head.
...you are not cut out to be a physician, and it is my responsibility...
to be a dickhead. How hard can that be? All you have to do is make sure your head is a dick, and it's attached to your neck.

[to Carin]
I love you not knowing how, why, or even from where.

[Mr. Mendelson's attorney is expressing concern over him using his land for Patch's free medical clinic]
You learn anything about proctology yet?
A little.
Good, take care of this asshole for me, will you?

[Patch is trying to convince Rudy not to be afraid of squirrels]
What could they want? Your nuts?
All of life is a coming home.
Who likes to masturbate?
[Everyone in room raises their hands]
How many fingers do you see?
Four.
No no! Look beyond the fingers! Now tell me how many you see.
Our job is to rigorously and ruthlessly train the humanity out of you and make you into something better. We're gonna make doctors out of you.
I'm not here to date. I'm not here to flirt. I'm here to study.
Ye of little faith.

[mis-remembering Fred's name]
Hey, how are you feeling, Frank? You feel better?
Yeah, pretty good.

[referring to a Marx Brothers movie Fred is watching]
Well, keep on your medication. You can never go wrong if you're a Marxist.
